title: Pleasant bar
text: Great bar to meet with friends for a casual drink. Has a big table at the back for large groups. You can bring your own food to eat there. They have a lot of beers, as well as other drinks. Also have a selection of board games to play. Nice interior.

title: Good Belgian Brasserie
text: A good place to go if you are looking for "standard" Belgian food - pasta, steak, lasagna, etc. Used to be my go-to place when eating with large groups.

title: Good Mexican Takeaway
text: Simple and limited choice, but tasty and decently priced Mexican food. Definitely worth a try if you are looking for budget-friendly Mexican cuisine.

title: Interesting Concept
text: Great place to try out if you're looking for something different. Combine a pizza with another dish/cuisine - nachos, curry, vol au vent, ... Although a tasty and fun experience, I still prefer a standard pizza or a standard curry (for example), so I would not go there often.

title: Leuven's Best Burgers
text: Here you can find Leuven's best burgers for an affordable price. The Lucifer is the best, followed by the Thunder.

title: Mediocre burgers
text: The burgers here are okay, but you can get a cheaper and tastier burger at other locations nearby in Leuven.

title: Pleasant visit
text: I especially liked the collection displaying work from several different artists, as they had more of a story to them, and had more variation from room to room. The larger exhibitions were less interesting to me, but that's because I am not *that* big a fan of photography, so that's not the museum's fault.

title: Bookshop or museum?
text: You can find the vast and diverse TASCHEN collection here, with beautiful books of all sizes covering a diverse range of topics. In the back the big, special copies are on display, resembling an art gallery or museum. Surprisingly affordable, with a standard sized wonderfully illustrated hardback costing only €15, and even the massive, majestic books often only costing €50.

title: Lots to explore
text: An impressively large forest on the edge of Brussels. There are many different walks starting from many different locations. I have lived pretty much in the middle of it (Tervuren) for my entire life, and still sometimes stumble upon new paths or entire swathes of forest.

title: Best falafels in Leuven
text: A great selection of falafel meals, tasty and affordable. A little out of the center, but doesn't take long to walk there.

title: Perfect way to explore Mechelen
text: Lovely walk all along the river. Perfect way to walk into the city from the station and then branch out to the other streets and locations.

title: Impressive tower, bright interior
text: Quite unique tower that can be seen from all around (and outside of) the city. Inside is lighter and airier than most churches, which I usually find rather dim and creepy.

title: The reason you visited Athens
text: As it is the reason you visited Athens, definitely worth a stop. Unfortunately scaffolding somewhat ruined our view, but still a pretty cool historic site.

title: A must see if town halls are your thing
text: One of the world's most beautiful town halls to see. Living in Leuven, I have grown somewhat immune to it, but I can still appreciate it if I stand still for a moment.

title: Great half-day trip
text: A lot of spots to explore when climbing Namur citadel. Nice (half) day trip for anyone really, but probably even more so if you're a history buff.

title: Unique student restaurant
text: A budget student restaurant with a fun concept and tasty food. Also has a "dessert wall" where you can get super yummy afters out of a machine.

title: Unique present ideas
text: Great place to find a special present for someone (perhaps yourself). A lot of unusual books, pretty plants, and stuffed animals integrated into furniture and ornaments.

title: Enjoy a unique book with a coffee
text: Nice interior to wander around in, with clearly discernible section covering fiction and non-fiction. A lot of beautiful and unique books to find.

title: Wide and varied range of books
text: Great all-round bookshop with a wide range of fiction, non-fiction and children's books. Something for everyone! You can usually also buy a coffee here, but that is currently on hold due to COVID-19.

title: Mediocre
text: A pretty average hotel. We had a room for four, which had a double bed and bunk beds, and not much floor space outside of that. Breakfast was very basic. Okay for a single night stopover, would not recommend for a multi-day stay.

title: Diverse gardens
text: Beautiful botanical garden, with a lot of varied plants outdoors and several different greenhouses with various plants.

title: Enjoy the lake - Beware of the cows!
text: Beautiful lake in the Swiss Alps. Enjoy a refreshing (well, cold) dip in this lake with a beautiful view of the mountains around you. Beware the cows and goats - they are not shy, and I saw a cow chase away some people and then eat their belongings.

title: Unique tunnel to nowhere
text: I'd been to Antwerp several times without knowing of the existence of this unusual tunnel under the Schelde. It's well worth a wander down the wooden escalators (which I have only ever seen before in New York) and through the rounded tunnel, although there is nothing much to see at the other end.

title: Unique Bookz and Exclusive Booze
text: Wonderful bookshop with a wide array of unique books accompanied by beautiful bottles of alcoholic beverages. Makes for a perfect combination to give as a gift (to yourself).

title: Great Food and Friendly Staff
text: Ate the best curry I've had in Belgium. Definitely order some (butter) naan with your main dish! The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. Greetings from Superman ;)

title: Exhilerating Experience
text: First we did the "Survivor" escape room, which left us hungry for more, leading us to do the "Ritual" escape room the following night. Both were different from what we were used to in escape rooms, as there was live action (actors in the room with you) and physical tasks (climbing/jumping/etc). The "Ritual" room was an especially unique experience - while the "Survivor" room suggests an extra pair of shoes, the "Ritual" room should suggest an extra pair of underwear! Not for the faint-hearted, even the most stoic of our group were screaming and running for their lives.

title: Beautiful view
text: Well worth the climb and five euros or so entrance fee! An amazing view over Hvar and the sea around it. Nice old fortress, with access to the dungeons underneath.

title: Keep expectations low
text: The Blue Cave was definitely a beautiful spot to visit, but is somewhat over-hyped and very touristy. You have to wait over an hour to get onto a boat that takes you to the cave, shows you around inside, and travels back again, which in total takes only about ten minutes. If you keep your expectations low, it's a nice visit, just don't expect too much.

title: Unforgettable day
text: Martina and Hrvoje took us on an amazing trip that was the highlight of our holiday in Croatia. Hrvoje was a great skipper, outrunning a storm with minutes to spare - especially impressive as it was his first time in a boat ;) We visited all the places promised, and also had our own say in which spots to visit. We also got to go snorkeling twice in the crystal clear water. A thrilling boat trip through choppy open sea finally brought us back safely to our destination. Thanks guys!
